newsitem.title: USA: Americans concerned about discount airline safety.
newsitem.headline: Americans concerned about discount airline safety.

text.p: Fifty one percent of Americans have reservations about the safety of discount airlines, while 59 percent expressed confidence in commercial airlines, according to a Time Magazine/CNN poll released on Saturday.

Only 39 percent of respondents said they had confidence in discount airlines, but that figure was up 8 percent from May 1996. The poll said 33 percent expressed reservations with commercial airline safety.
Compared with five years ago, 42 percent of Americans believed commerical flying was less safe, with 36 percent saying it was safer, the poll added.

More than 60 percent cite poor airline maintenance, aging planes, the threat of terrorism and the failure of manufacturers to fix identified safety problems as the main reasons commerical flying is less safe.
The poll surveyed 1,018 adults and had an error of margin of plus/minus 3.1 percent.
